
2025-03-06

# Chief Complaint
- Fatigue
- Frequent Urination
- Hunger
- Thirst


# History of Present Illness
Anderson154
 is a 58 year-old nonhispanic white male. Patient has a history of gingival disease (disorder), streptococcal sore throat (disorder), acute bacterial sinusitis (disorder), severe anxiety (panic) (finding), medication review due (situation), acute viral pharyngitis (disorder), leaking dental filling (finding), victim of intimate partner abuse (finding), misuses drugs (finding), viral sinusitis (disorder), fractured dental filling (finding), part-time employment (finding), resorption of alveolar process due to dental trauma (disorder), limited social contact (finding), not in labor force (finding), unhealthy alcohol drinking behavior (finding), primary dental caries (disorder), reports of violence in the environment (finding), infection of tooth (disorder), full-time employment (finding), dental filling lost (finding), gingivitis (disorder), stress (finding), social isolation (finding).

# Social History
Patient is single. Patient has never smoked.
 Patient identifies as heterosexual.

Patient comes from a middle socioeconomic background.
 Patient has a high school education.
Patient currently has Anthem.

# Allergies
No Known Allergies.

# Medications
lisinopril 10 mg oral tablet; lopinavir 200 mg / ritonavir 50 mg oral tablet; emtricitabine 200 mg / tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg oral tablet; penicillin v potassium 500 mg oral tablet; amlodipine 2.5 mg oral tablet; insulin lispro 100 unt/ml injectable solution [humalog]; ritonavir 100 mg oral capsule; sulfamethoxazole 800 mg / trimethoprim 160 mg oral tablet; darunavir 800 mg oral tablet; amoxicillin 250 mg / clavulanate 125 mg oral tablet; sodium fluoride 0.0272 mg/mg oral gel

# Assessment and Plan


## Plan

The following procedures were conducted:
- renal dialysis (procedure)

 Patient identifies as heterosexual.

Patient comes from a middle socioeconomic background.
 Patient has a high school education.

# Assessment and Plan
Patient is presenting with primary dental caries (disorder). 

## Plan

The following procedures were conducted:
- dental consultation and report (procedure)
- dental care (regime/therapy)
- removal of supragingival plaque and calculus from all teeth using dental instrument (procedure)
- removal of subgingival plaque and calculus from all teeth using dental instrument (procedure)
- examination of gingivae (procedure)
- application of composite dental filling material to dentin of tooth following fracture of tooth (procedure)
- oral health education (procedure)

 Patient identifies as heterosexual.

Patient has a history of gingival disease (disorder), streptococcal sore throat (disorder), acute bacterial sinusitis (disorder), severe anxiety (panic) (finding), medication review due (situation), acute viral pharyngitis (disorder), leaking dental filling (finding), victim of intimate partner abuse (finding), misuses drugs (finding), fractured dental filling (finding), part-time employment (finding), resorption of alveolar process due to dental trauma (disorder), limited social contact (finding), not in labor force (finding), unhealthy alcohol drinking behavior (finding), primary dental caries (disorder), reports of violence in the environment (finding), infection of tooth (disorder), full-time employment (finding), dental filling lost (finding), gingivitis (disorder), stress (finding), social isolation (finding).

# Social History
Patient is single. Patient has never smoked.
 Patient identifies as heterosexual.

Patient comes from a middle socioeconomic background.
 Patient has a high school education.
Patient currently has Cigna Health.

# Allergies
No Known Allergies.

# Medications
lisinopril 10 mg oral tablet; lopinavir 200 mg / ritonavir 50 mg oral tablet; emtricitabine 200 mg / tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg oral tablet; penicillin v potassium 500 mg oral tablet; amlodipine 2.5 mg oral tablet; insulin lispro 100 unt/ml injectable solution [humalog]; ritonavir 100 mg oral capsule; sulfamethoxazole 800 mg / trimethoprim 160 mg oral tablet; darunavir 800 mg oral tablet; amoxicillin 250 mg / clavulanate 125 mg oral tablet; sodium fluoride 0.0272 mg/mg oral gel

Patient has a history of gingival disease (disorder), streptococcal sore throat (disorder), severe anxiety (panic) (finding), medication review due (situation), acute viral pharyngitis (disorder), leaking dental filling (finding), victim of intimate partner abuse (finding), misuses drugs (finding), fractured dental filling (finding), part-time employment (finding), resorption of alveolar process due to dental trauma (disorder), limited social contact (finding), not in labor force (finding), unhealthy alcohol drinking behavior (finding), primary dental caries (disorder), reports of violence in the environment (finding), infection of tooth (disorder), full-time employment (finding), dental filling lost (finding), gingivitis (disorder), stress (finding), social isolation (finding).

# Social History
Patient is single. Patient has never smoked.
 Patient identifies as heterosexual.

Patient comes from a middle socioeconomic background.
 Patient has a high school education.
Patient currently has Cigna Health.

# Allergies
No Known Allergies.

# Medications
lisinopril 10 mg oral tablet; lopinavir 200 mg / ritonavir 50 mg oral tablet; emtricitabine 200 mg / tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg oral tablet; penicillin v potassium 500 mg oral tablet; amlodipine 2.5 mg oral tablet; insulin lispro 100 unt/ml injectable solution [humalog]; ritonavir 100 mg oral capsule; sulfamethoxazole 800 mg / trimethoprim 160 mg oral tablet; darunavir 800 mg oral tablet; sodium fluoride 0.0272 mg/mg oral gel

Patient has a history of gingival disease (disorder), streptococcal sore throat (disorder), severe anxiety (panic) (finding), medication review due (situation), acute viral pharyngitis (disorder), leaking dental filling (finding), victim of intimate partner abuse (finding), misuses drugs (finding), fractured dental filling (finding), part-time employment (finding), resorption of alveolar process due to dental trauma (disorder), limited social contact (finding), not in labor force (finding), unhealthy alcohol drinking behavior (finding), primary dental caries (disorder), reports of violence in the environment (finding), infection of tooth (disorder), full-time employment (finding), dental filling lost (finding), gingivitis (disorder), stress (finding), social isolation (finding).

# Social History
Patient is single. Patient has never smoked.
 Patient identifies as heterosexual.

Patient comes from a middle socioeconomic background.
 Patient has a high school education.
Patient currently has Cigna Health.

# Allergies
No Known Allergies.

lisinopril 10 mg oral tablet; lopinavir 200 mg / ritonavir 50 mg oral tablet; emtricitabine 200 mg / tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg oral tablet; penicillin v potassium 500 mg oral tablet; amlodipine 2.5 mg oral tablet; insulin lispro 100 unt/ml injectable solution [humalog]; ritonavir 100 mg oral capsule; sulfamethoxazole 800 mg / trimethoprim 160 mg oral tablet; darunavir 800 mg oral tablet; sodium fluoride 0.0272 mg/mg oral gel

# Assessment and Plan
Patient is presenting with gingival disease (disorder). 

## Plan

The following procedures were conducted:
- dental consultation and report (procedure)
- dental care (regime/therapy)
- removal of supragingival plaque and calculus from all teeth using dental instrument (procedure)
- removal of subgingival plaque and calculus from all teeth using dental instrument (procedure)
- dental plain x-ray bitewing (procedure)
- examination of gingivae (procedure)
- dental surgical procedure (procedure)
- dental application of desensitizing medicament (procedure)
- gingivectomy or gingivoplasty, per tooth (procedure)
- postoperative care for dental procedure (regime/therapy)
- dental fluoride treatment (procedure)
- oral health education (procedure)
The patient was prescribed the following medications:
- sodium fluoride 0.0272 mg/mg oral gel

- dental consultation and report (procedure)
- dental care (regime/therapy)
- removal of supragingival plaque and calculus from all teeth using dental instrument (procedure)
- removal of subgingival plaque and calculus from all teeth using dental instrument (procedure)
- dental plain x-ray bitewing (procedure)
- examination of gingivae (procedure)
- dental fluoride treatment (procedure)
- oral health education (procedure)
The patient was prescribed the following medications:
- sodium fluoride 0.0272 mg/mg oral gel

- Frequent Urination
- Hunger
- Thirst


# History of Present Illness
Anderson154
 is a 54 year-old nonhispanic white male. Patient has a history of gingival disease (disorder), severe anxiety (panic) (finding), medication review due (situation), acute viral pharyngitis (disorder), leaking dental filling (finding), victim of intimate partner abuse (finding), misuses drugs (finding), fractured dental filling (finding), part-time employment (finding), resorption of alveolar process due to dental trauma (disorder), limited social contact (finding), not in labor force (finding), unhealthy alcohol drinking behavior (finding), primary dental caries (disorder), reports of violence in the environment (finding), infection of tooth (disorder), full-time employment (finding), dental filling lost (finding), gingivitis (disorder), stress (finding), social isolation (finding).

# Social History
Patient is single. Patient has never smoked.
 Patient identifies as heterosexual.

Patient comes from a middle socioeconomic background.
 Patient has a high school education.
Patient currently has Cigna Health.

# Allergies
No Known Allergies.

# Medications
lisinopril 10 mg oral tablet; lopinavir 200 mg / ritonavir 50 mg oral tablet; emtricitabine 200 mg / tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg oral tablet; amlodipine 2.5 mg oral tablet; insulin lispro 100 unt/ml injectable solution [humalog]; ritonavir 100 mg oral capsule; sulfamethoxazole 800 mg / trimethoprim 160 mg oral tablet; darunavir 800 mg oral tablet; sodium fluoride 0.0272 mg/mg oral gel

# Assessment and Plan


## Plan

The following procedures were conducted:
- renal dialysis (procedure)

Patient is presenting with dental filling lost (finding). 

## Plan

- dental care (regime/therapy)

- dental plain x-ray bitewing (procedure)
- examination of gingivae (procedure)
- application of composite dental filling material to dentin of tooth following fracture of tooth (procedure)
- oral health education (procedure)

Patient has a history of gingival disease (disorder), severe anxiety (panic) (finding), medication review due (situation), acute viral pharyngitis (disorder), leaking dental filling (finding), victim of intimate partner abuse (finding), misuses drugs (finding), fractured dental filling (finding), part-time employment (finding), resorption of alveolar process due to dental trauma (disorder), limited social contact (finding), not in labor force (finding), unhealthy alcohol drinking behavior (finding), primary dental caries (disorder), reports of violence in the environment (finding), infection of tooth (disorder), full-time employment (finding), dental filling lost (finding), gingivitis (disorder), stress (finding), social isolation (finding).

# Social History
Patient is single. Patient has never smoked.
 Patient identifies as heterosexual.

Patient comes from a middle socioeconomic background.
 Patient has a high school education.
Patient currently has Anthem.

# Allergies
No Known Allergies.

# Medications
lisinopril 10 mg oral tablet; lopinavir 200 mg / ritonavir 50 mg oral tablet; emtricitabine 200 mg / tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg oral tablet; amlodipine 2.5 mg oral tablet; insulin lispro 100 unt/ml injectable solution [humalog]; ritonavir 100 mg oral capsule; sulfamethoxazole 800 mg / trimethoprim 160 mg oral tablet; darunavir 800 mg oral tablet; sodium fluoride 0.0272 mg/mg oral gel

Patient has a history of gingival disease (disorder), severe anxiety (panic) (finding), medication review due (situation), acute viral pharyngitis (disorder), leaking dental filling (finding), victim of intimate partner abuse (finding), misuses drugs (finding), fractured dental filling (finding), part-time employment (finding), resorption of alveolar process due to dental trauma (disorder), limited social contact (finding), not in labor force (finding), unhealthy alcohol drinking behavior (finding), primary dental caries (disorder), reports of violence in the environment (finding), infection of tooth (disorder), full-time employment (finding), dental filling lost (finding), gingivitis (disorder), stress (finding), social isolation (finding).

# Social History
Patient is single. Patient has never smoked.
 Patient identifies as heterosexual.

Patient comes from a middle socioeconomic background.
 Patient has a high school education.
Patient currently has Anthem.

# Allergies
No Known Allergies.

# Medications
lisinopril 10 mg oral tablet; lopinavir 200 mg / ritonavir 50 mg oral tablet; emtricitabine 200 mg / tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg oral tablet; amlodipine 2.5 mg oral tablet; insulin lispro 100 unt/ml injectable solution [humalog]; ritonavir 100 mg oral capsule; sulfamethoxazole 800 mg / trimethoprim 160 mg oral tablet; darunavir 800 mg oral tablet; sodium fluoride 0.0272 mg/mg oral gel

# Assessment and Plan


## Plan
Patient was given the following immunizations: tetanus toxoid, reduced diphtheria toxoid, and acellular pertussis vaccine, adsorbed, meningococcal polysaccharide (groups a, c, y and w-135) diphtheria toxoid conjugate vaccine (mcv4p). 
The following procedures were conducted:
- history and physical examination, limited (procedure)
- human immunodeficiency virus viral load (procedure)
- complete blood count with white cell differential, automated (procedure)
- absolute cd4 count procedure (procedure)

lisinopril 10 mg oral tablet; lopinavir 200 mg / ritonavir 50 mg oral tablet; emtricitabine 200 mg / tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg oral tablet; amlodipine 2.5 mg oral tablet; insulin lispro 100 unt/ml injectable solution [humalog]; ritonavir 100 mg oral capsule; sulfamethoxazole 800 mg / trimethoprim 160 mg oral tablet; darunavir 800 mg oral tablet; sodium fluoride 0.0272 mg/mg oral gel

# Assessment and Plan
Patient is presenting with leaking dental filling (finding). 

## Plan

The following procedures were conducted:
- dental consultation and report (procedure)
- dental care (regime/therapy)
- removal of supragingival plaque and calculus from all teeth using dental instrument (procedure)
- removal of subgingival plaque and calculus from all teeth using dental instrument (procedure)
- dental plain x-ray bitewing (procedure)
- examination of gingivae (procedure)
- application of composite dental filling material to dentin of tooth following fracture of tooth (procedure)
- oral health education (procedure)

Patient has a history of gingival disease (disorder), medication review due (situation), acute viral pharyngitis (disorder), leaking dental filling (finding), victim of intimate partner abuse (finding), misuses drugs (finding), fractured dental filling (finding), part-time employment (finding), resorption of alveolar process due to dental trauma (disorder), limited social contact (finding), unhealthy alcohol drinking behavior (finding), primary dental caries (disorder), reports of violence in the environment (finding), infection of tooth (disorder), full-time employment (finding), dental filling lost (finding), gingivitis (disorder), stress (finding), social isolation (finding).

# Social History
Patient is single. Patient has never smoked.
 Patient identifies as heterosexual.

Patient comes from a middle socioeconomic background.
 Patient has a high school education.
Patient currently has Anthem.

# Allergies
No Known Allergies.

# Medications
lisinopril 10 mg oral tablet; lopinavir 200 mg / ritonavir 50 mg oral tablet; emtricitabine 200 mg / tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg oral tablet; amlodipine 2.5 mg oral tablet; insulin lispro 100 unt/ml injectable solution [humalog]; ritonavir 100 mg oral capsule; sulfamethoxazole 800 mg / trimethoprim 160 mg oral tablet; darunavir 800 mg oral tablet; sodium fluoride 0.0272 mg/mg oral gel

# Assessment and Plan
Patient is presenting with medication review due (situation). 

## Plan

The following procedures were conducted:
- medication reconciliation (procedure)
- assessment of health and social care needs (procedure)
- assessment of substance use (procedure)
- screening for drug abuse (procedure)
The patient was prescribed the following medications:
- ritonavir 100 mg oral capsule
- darunavir 800 mg oral tablet
- insulin lispro 100 unt/ml injectable solution [humalog]
- lisinopril 10 mg oral tablet
- amlodipine 2.5 mg oral tablet
- emtricitabine 200 mg / tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg oral tablet

 Patient identifies as heterosexual.

Patient comes from a middle socioeconomic background.
 Patient has a high school education.
Patient currently has Anthem.

# Allergies
No Known Allergies.

# Medications
lisinopril 10 mg oral tablet; lopinavir 200 mg / ritonavir 50 mg oral tablet; emtricitabine 200 mg / tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg oral tablet; amlodipine 2.5 mg oral tablet; insulin lispro 100 unt/ml injectable solution [humalog]; ritonavir 100 mg oral capsule; sulfamethoxazole 800 mg / trimethoprim 160 mg oral tablet; darunavir 800 mg oral tablet; sodium fluoride 0.0272 mg/mg oral gel

# Assessment and Plan
Patient is presenting with fractured dental filling (finding). 

## Plan

The following procedures were conducted:
- dental consultation and report (procedure)
- dental care (regime/therapy)
- removal of supragingival plaque and calculus from all teeth using dental instrument (procedure)
- removal of subgingival plaque and calculus from all teeth using dental instrument (procedure)
- dental plain x-ray bitewing (procedure)
- examination of gingivae (procedure)
- restoration of tooth with coverage of all cusps using dental filling material (procedure)
- dental fluoride treatment (procedure)
- oral health education (procedure)
The patient was prescribed the following medications:
- sodium fluoride 0.0272 mg/mg oral gel

lisinopril 10 mg oral tablet; lopinavir 200 mg / ritonavir 50 mg oral tablet; emtricitabine 200 mg / tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg oral tablet; amlodipine 2.5 mg oral tablet; insulin lispro 100 unt/ml injectable solution [humalog]; ritonavir 100 mg oral capsule; sulfamethoxazole 800 mg / trimethoprim 160 mg oral tablet; darunavir 800 mg oral tablet; sodium fluoride 0.0272 mg/mg oral gel

# Assessment and Plan
Patient is presenting with gingival disease (disorder). 

## Plan

The following procedures were conducted:
- dental consultation and report (procedure)
- dental care (regime/therapy)
- removal of supragingival plaque and calculus from all teeth using dental instrument (procedure)
- removal of subgingival plaque and calculus from all teeth using dental instrument (procedure)
- dental plain x-ray bitewing (procedure)
- examination of gingivae (procedure)
- dental surgical procedure (procedure)
- dental application of desensitizing medicament (procedure)
- gingivectomy or gingivoplasty, per tooth (procedure)
- postoperative care for dental procedure (regime/therapy)
- oral health education (procedure)

Patient is single. Patient has never smoked.
 Patient identifies as heterosexual.

Patient comes from a middle socioeconomic background.
 Patient has a high school education.
Patient currently has Anthem.

# Allergies
No Known Allergies.

# Medications
lisinopril 10 mg oral tablet; lopinavir 200 mg / ritonavir 50 mg oral tablet; emtricitabine 200 mg / tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg oral tablet; amlodipine 2.5 mg oral tablet; insulin lispro 100 unt/ml injectable solution [humalog]; ritonavir 100 mg oral capsule; sulfamethoxazole 800 mg / trimethoprim 160 mg oral tablet; darunavir 800 mg oral tablet; sodium fluoride 0.0272 mg/mg oral gel

# Assessment and Plan
Patient is presenting with primary dental caries (disorder). 

## Plan

The following procedures were conducted:
- dental consultation and report (procedure)
- dental care (regime/therapy)
- removal of supragingival plaque and calculus from all teeth using dental instrument (procedure)
- removal of subgingival plaque and calculus from all teeth using dental instrument (procedure)
- dental plain x-ray bitewing (procedure)
- examination of gingivae (procedure)
- application of composite dental filling material to dentin of tooth following fracture of tooth (procedure)
- oral health education (procedure)

lisinopril 10 mg oral tablet; lopinavir 200 mg / ritonavir 50 mg oral tablet; emtricitabine 200 mg / tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg oral tablet; amlodipine 2.5 mg oral tablet; insulin lispro 100 unt/ml injectable solution [humalog]; ritonavir 100 mg oral capsule; sulfamethoxazole 800 mg / trimethoprim 160 mg oral tablet; darunavir 800 mg oral tablet; sodium fluoride 0.0272 mg/mg oral gel

## Plan

- dental care (regime/therapy)

- removal of subgingival plaque and calculus from all teeth using dental instrument (procedure)
- examination of gingivae (procedure)
- dental surgical procedure (procedure)
- dental application of desensitizing medicament (procedure)
- gingivectomy or gingivoplasty, per tooth (procedure)
- postoperative care for dental procedure (regime/therapy)
- restoration of tooth with coverage of all cusps using dental filling material (procedure)
- oral health education (procedure)

- insulin lispro 100 unt/ml injectable solution [humalog]
- lisinopril 10 mg oral tablet
- amlodipine 2.5 mg oral tablet
- lopinavir 200 mg / ritonavir 50 mg oral tablet
- emtricitabine 200 mg / tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg oral tablet
